intro: Pigea fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered pigeonwings, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Pigea fasciculata typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
